title: Can you people learn how to lose?
body:
Like, I'm so sick of having to deal with my bot lane going 0/5/0-0/8/0 in the first 15 minutes of the game. It's like you don't have a sense of how to play from behind.

Learn how to fucking tether and get the minions you can, stay under tower, play safer, stop doing trades, stop putting yourself in places that will make you easy to catch, stop giving up after 2 deaths.

I can't carry your dumb ass if you become a lane minion and just walk into them and die.

just fucking farm and stop talking/inting

If they posture for a dive you can always back off your tower and let them zone you.  It sucks, but it beats losing all that farm/exp AND giving your opponent another kill.
Or start to back off and get killed by the jungle pincering you, while your jungle is afk in the river bush waiting for scuttle to spawn.
That's just a good gank.  Your tower can't and shouldn't protect you against bad play or good junglers.
I love when people stay under tower to "defend it" and just die and lose the tower anyway, but in this scenario they kick someone off the map for 30+ seconds and get a 300g bonus.

Not gonna disagree with the post because this IS frustrating, but if it were this simple, we simply wouldnt have 0/8/0 teammates. 

How not to int varies depending on the circumstances. Example, your lane is losing, enemies have pushed you under tower. Because you have no vision control, the enemy jungler can sneak into tribrush to attempt a dive. This cant be avoided because you simply cant know hes there without facechecking, which would also cause instant death. Its a terrible cycle tbh.

Or take just farming, you afk farm and let yourself get pushed in, yielding lane priority and the ability to respond to a teamfight first. The enemy gets fed off of a fight, setting them even farther ahead of you, allowing them to faceroll you under your tower.

Except that scenario is EASILY stopped by 75g. You should put a control ward there anyway if you are constantly under tower because it makes your jungler have a hell of an easy time ganking since they will know there is no vision and can take the blast cone behind them for free.

Can't maintain vision control if you don't have lane priority. All you did was give the enemy 25g.

Also, most of the time that pink near your turret ain't gonna help you. They'll just go right past it and push you off turret/kill you under turret/kill you as you try to run away from turret.

As simple and condescending as it sounds, "Stop Dying" is the best advice. The longer you live, the more time you have to catch up and punish mistakes.

I think you might want to reword the title. There's a difference between learning how to play from behind & learning how to lose.

One involves playing passively & trying to farm as much as you can while not dying, even if you have to give up a tower. Wait for jungle to come around & help. Unless you're top where your jungle never ganks while their jungle camps & tower dives your ass 24/7. Okay, I'm just kidding on that last one...........25% kidding.
Also, try roaming to another if possible & if you think you guys can score something (bonus points if you're playing a champ who still can be useful from behind like a tank). Then group up with teammates, who have a lead (hopefully), for objectives or to push a lane.
Of course, this is all based on the assumption you only gave your lane opponent 1 or 2 kills rather than 5 or 6 & you're still relatively close in CS & not down by 50+ at the 10 minute mark. If you are that far behind, welp, just gotta play extra safe & ride on your teammates back.
Though, if every lane lost & the jungler is behind, that's a different story.

The other involves AFK-ing, int feeding like you're an "all you can eat" buffet & playing dumb shit like full AP Zed while stealing your teammates farm & spamming your mastery 7 every time. Only to be reported by 4-9 people afterwards.
